name: Hilton Shanghai

reviews.text: Nice hotel, in line with Hilton standards. The location is not so close to the most interesting places in Shanghai, like Bund, People Square (and his museums), Pudong, Yu Gardens. Around the hotel there are not so much places for dinner, but Xintiandi is at 10 minutes by taxi. I travelled with a baby and the staff helped me for everything (babycot and highchair in the room, for example). Breakfast and dinner had a good choice of dishes.
reviews.title: Stay with a baby

reviews.text: First trip to Shanghai. We loved the property from the staff attitudes to the large, airy lobby and restaurants to the very comfortable rooms. It is away from the downtown mob and Pudong construction, is close to many restaurants in the French Concession, and is a half-block away from the metro. When space was available, we were upgraded to the executive floors with its first-rate club lounge. Before that, we were comped a very nice breakfast in the downstairs lobby. Very attractive property with great workout facilities. When not eating at local restaurants, we enjoyed the upstairs Sichuan restaurant very much.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel in a great location

likes.liked: — Away from the crowd but easy access to attractions.

reviews.text: The Jing'an Temple metro stop (Line 2) is just across the freeway, a five minute walk with an elevated walkway to get across the main street. The metro was far more convenient for many destinations than a cab and made trips to People's Square, East Nanjing Road, and Pudong fast and reliable. Escalators (almost always working) made the short trip between the metro and hotel even easier. With lots of luggage, a cheap 11 yuan taxi ride gets you to/from the hotel.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.text: Since the hotel is in the French Concession, many good restaurants are within walking distance or a very short taxi ride. Plus, there are lots of trees, some nice parks, and no crush of high-rise buildings.
reviews.title: Wow! What a GREAT place!

reviews.text: Great stay in a well organised hotel with excellent facilities.
reviews.title: Great - would stay there again

reviews.text: I have stayed at this hotel several times in the last few years. If you get one of the renovated rooms, you get the updated furnishings in the bedroom, (flat screen TV and nice work desk etc) but the older rooms have very dated furniture and questionable electrical cord/outlets. Bathroom could use renovation as well. There seems to be no price difference, so I would ask for renovated room even if the room size is smaller. Most of the time, there's a line at the front desk for check-in/check-out, so I recommend giving yourself some extra time for check-out in the morning. The hotel has a very nice fitness room with state of the art equipment. If you are in the mood for going out for dinner, I'd recommend extra time waiting in line for taxi in the evening as well.
reviews.title: Renovated rooms are nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: stayed here in Feb 09 on a sale rate available from the hotel website, excellent value, i think we were in a very basic room category but was quite pleased with the state of the room, very clean and comfortable and a nice view over french concession townhouses.
reviews.title: very pleasing choice

reviews.text: had absolutely no problems with check in and all services. its a very busy hotel so you can be as anonymous as you like or take up the many services, depends on your style. the breakfast in the lobby was good, nice atmosphere and good range. however the taste of shanghai water is rather heavily chemicalised, not the hotels fault though.
reviews.title: Upscale but Inconvenient

reviews.text: people have talked about the location being far from the bund and peoples square main drag, well, shanghai is a huge city so i guess it depends on what areas you want to visit as to whether the location is a problem. we found the location good for exploring the western side of the city, jingan temple nearby, french concession area at the doorfront, and with the subway not too far away it is easy to get to other areas. the hotel is also right next to an overhead expressway so its easy to get in and out.
reviews.title: Not up to Hilton Standards

reviews.text: gym facilities were good, heaps of cardio machines and about 6-7 life fitness machines, some fitness classes available too. indoor pool was lovely, also a good size. jacuzzi, sauna and steam was clean, attractive and well run. in sum, a great choice, would definitely go back.
reviews.title: Great Staff and Executive Lounge

reviews.text: Excellent room - good view, plenty of room. Friendly, helpful staff who all spoke English. Great location - a short walk to the metro, on a street with decent restaurants, a park and a temple and a short (cheap!) taxi-ride everywhere we wanted to go. The breakfast buffet was excellent - a blend of Western and Chinese choices and very nice service. We used the overnight laundry service several times and were very pleased. The concierge arranged tickets for us for an evening river cruise - it was a little confusing because the weather was variable and they didn't actually book the tickets until the morning of the day I wanted the cruise, which I hadn't understood was how they were going to do it. The one downside was that internet service cost $20/day and there's no wi-fi access (even if you pay for internet access) above the 19th floor. Every other hotel I stayed at in China (even in much smaller cities) had free wi-fi. Other than that caveat, a great place to stay.
reviews.title: Great place to stay in Shanghai

reviews.text: this is a fabulous hotel - the service from the staff may be the best i've ever experienced. executive level rooms are well worth it for the breakfast, cocktail hour, separate check-in and check out. rooms are very nice. the hotel was warm most of the time we were there - not sure why but that was bothersome. good location close to the french concession. the staff writes down for your in chinese where you want to go and you give that to the taxi. taxis are very cheap. our taxi from the airport to the hotel (an hour ride) was only $27. there is no tipping in shanghai. the staff in the executive lounge remembered every day where we liked to sit, what our drink order was, etc. one day when we overslept they still managed to find us some breakfast. a great place to stay.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel

reviews.text: OK hotel, ten minutes walk from an underground station.
reviews.title: Ok rooms.....VERY expensive WIFI

reviews.text: The WIFI costs were astounding.
reviews.title: Average Hilton

reviews.text: Nice and big hotel, breakfast is average. not so close to the bund and other places but its 10 minutes taxi drive to everywhere. it costs about 4 dollars to the bund and other places. rooms are average not to big compared to beijing hotels. before going anywhere with taxi ask reception to write down the address in chines because drivers do not understand even a single word in english, even the do not understand hilton
reviews.title: Excellent Place to Stay in Shanghai.

reviews.text: Stayed at this property many times before.
reviews.title: Consistently high quality

reviews.text: This time I managed to get a brand-new (at least that's how it smelled) business room on the executive floor. Two short nights unfortunately did not allow a visit to the executive lounge.
reviews.title: Good!

reviews.text: Extremely functional and nice room, loved the bed and the bathroom was also very nicely decorated.
reviews.title: A bit business orientated but not bad

likes.liked: — The location is the best thing

reviews.text: Enjoyed the breakfast downstairs at the Lobby level; great choice (nice German choice). Incredibly efficient.
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.text: All in all, a very convenient hotel in great location. Not too far from the old Shanghai airport but about 45 to 60 minutes drive to Pudong Airport.
reviews.title: Very good and getting better

reviews.text: The hotel is very good and you get the best of everything. The location is prime and walking distance to many restaurants and shopping centers. The restaurants in the hotel are solid and the all you can eat buffet in the second floor offers good value with many different choices of food.
reviews.title: Great hotel, excellent location!

reviews.text: Perfect place to stay when you are in Shanghai. I have stayed here for two weeks in 2011. Great hospitality and what's best is everyone in the hotel knows english. You can get the directions and address written in Chinese from them since most taxi drivers dont know english. Taxis are available round the clock. Great restaurants for all budgets available in the neighbourhood. Food , decor, cleanliness is at its best. Excellent view especially in the night. The only drawback - Internet is deadly expensive.
reviews.title: Excellent Place to Stay

reviews.text: We spent five sensational nights at the Shanghai Hilton in one of their recently renovated rooms on the 30th floor. A spacious, super comfortable room with a spectacular view, lovely amenities and excellent prompt service combined to make our stay delightful. The only caveat is that breakfast was not included and was super expensive (about $30). We used the coffee supplies in the room and bought baguettes and butter at the bread store in the nearby mall and enjoyed breakfast in bed at a bargain price. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Hilton Can Be Proud

reviews.text: We arrived on Friday 21.10.11 at 1.30am: hotel fully booked, Twin beds rooms only, our reservation was gone and our romantic week end at the same time. We ended up in a three stars room like or even worst as TV dated back from the 90's, furnitures were damaged and floor/ceiling crakled, no view and walls were quite thin if you see what I mean....
reviews.title: Worst satisfaction/price ratio ever!

reviews.text: The day after: hotel offered breakfast and we were upgraded to a deluxe room....not as impressive as in previous hiltons I stayed at: small bathroom, dirty carpet...eventhough it was much better than what we had on the fist night. However, when packing a cockroach showed up in the wardrobe....Hotel waived 1/3 of total price. We won't go back there.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location, some service issues

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a very good experience staying here early December for 4 nights. Location was excellent, and just a short taxi ride to the Bund area and other places of interest. Room on the 34th floor was spacious, it had a good desk, comfortable bed, even built-in electrical adaptors for US appliances. The executive lounge was also excellent, with very attentive service, and great views of the city. And able to have a cooked breakfast there, with eggs cooked to order, as well as afternoon snacks, and evening snacks. Concierge was very helpful arranging sightseeing for us Would definitely stay there again on a return visit.
reviews.title: Excellent stay at this hotel

reviews.text: Excellent warm welcome in large Lobby and hustling international crowd. Executive Lounge On 38th floor; also for Check-in HoNMembers. Fast track Check-in and moving to rather tiny rooms.
reviews.title: Good Place, though a bit remote

reviews.text: Too Bad WLAN is chargeable, unless your in the Lounge area. At this Rates it should be in inclusive.
reviews.title: As expected - Top Class

reviews.text: Taste breakfast offerings. Very poor happy hour offerings. Benchmark for me would be Marco polo HK on the club Floor (18th).
reviews.title: Good hotel, few things to improve

reviews.text: Stayed in hotel for two nights end of November and early December. The first night was in standard room. Cannot complain, good standard, housekeeping very good. On the second visit, I was upgraded to 37th floor (Executive Floor) which enabled me to go into the Exec Lounge and bar. This is really excellent and the views across Shanghai are second to none. On both visits I found all staff very couteous and would certainly stop again. This hotel is what we expect from the Hilton standard.
reviews.title: pleasant stay

reviews.text: I just spent 3 nights at the Hilton Shanghai. This was my second stay at this hotel and there were no rooms available on the Honors floor and I had what looked like a beaten Hilton Garden Inn for $300/night. Used the meeting facilities and the room was old, smelled and had mold on the ceiling. Asked the hotel to arrange a cab to the airport and was charged 600RMB for a 150RMB ride all for the privilege of the hotel organizing it. Worst Hilton experience WW.
reviews.title: Over priced, not good for a Hilton.

reviews.text: Mixed feelings
reviews.title: Mixed feelings

reviews.text: Stayed for 4 nights in a Deluxe Plus room (did a standby upgrade from deluxe for 125RMB a night when booking the deluxe room).
reviews.title: A bit old but still ok

reviews.text: The positives:
reviews.title: A Great Stay and the Staff is Excellent

reviews.text: 1) The room itself was recently done up, on the 29th floor and had a great view over Shanghai, looking directly towards the Bund and Pudong in the distance. Room size and style was fine, bathroom a little cramped.
reviews.title: Rooms and executive lounge are very good, rest of property is average

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed for 3 nights, since I am a HH Gold was directed to executive lounge upon check in. This lounge has just opened up in late January and is impressive. It is Huge, wraps around the entire east and south side. Many plasma tv and tasteful Chinese decoration. Since someone else was being checked in, I was invited to sit down in one of the many sofas and enjoy a welcome cocktail. Staff was extremely friendly, the best English speaking staff I have had in China. Remembered my name throughout the 3 days. Was given an executive floor upgrade, full access to lounge for breakfast, afternoon hot and cold snacks, plenty that it was enough for my dinner. Free internet. Free drinks from 5-7, I tried for first time Chinese wine and was impressed, and I am a fan of wine. Room was spacious, all amenities of a Hilton, welcome fruit, flowers and chocolates in a nice bamboo box. Large plasma tv. One day after being exhausted of walking the entire day, used the spa, very nice. Had relaxing rooms, steam, sauna, hot tubs, etc. Large indoor pool. Offers spinning, yoga, free weights. Very nice spa.
reviews.title: Treated like a King - Huge Executive Lounge

reviews.text: The location is on the west side of the city, can be distant if you want to stick to Bund or Pudong, but it is a quick cab ride away, quicker by metro. I got there from airport by taking Maglev, then transferring to metro line 2. You get out by the jing an temple, walk south one block towards park and elevated highway, take pedestrian overpass the had non functioning escalators which was a hugr nuisance and then the Hilton is on the right hand side. Easy to get around by subway. It is on the west end of French concession area, so a 10-15 minute walk to central area of French concession area and Huaihai road.
reviews.title: As Nice as It Gets

reviews.text: Overall excellent service, best executive lounge that I have been to date. Only con would be location if you want to be on Nanjing road, Bund or Pudong, but personally would not be willing to give up service and amenities for location for the rate I was paying.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.text: The Hilton brand offers some hotels of questionable luxury but this locaton rivals The Four Seasons which, for me, is the best.
reviews.title: Not as bad as some reviews

reviews.text: The room decor and service were impecable. Standard rooms come with flat screen television and very comfortable comtemporary furniture. The suite are large and with large tv's in the master suites and a control panel at bedside.
reviews.title: Expensive & worn out

description: The recently refurbished Hilton Shanghai hotel towers impressively above the city's former French Concession and is located in the heart of Shanghai's business and entertainment districts. Within walking distance of Shanghai's exclusive shopping streets, Nanjing Xi Lu and Huaihai Lu, this prestigious Shanghai hotel is close to Shanghai attractions such as Jing'an Temple and Jing'an Park. Pudong International Airport is a 50-minute drive away and Hongqiao Airport is only 20 minutes from the hotel. Hold your next conference in one of the 18 meeting rooms or choose the elegant Grand Ballroom at this Shanghai hotel. All contemporary Hilton Shanghai hotel Guest Rooms offer a spacious work area, wireless Internet access and large windows offering views of the city. Choose and Executive Room for access to the 38th floor Executive Lounge. After a busy day, relax in the spa, enjoy a game of squash or work out in fitness center at the Hilton Shanghai hotel. Choose from one of the hotel's 8 restaurants and bars and Dine on fresh seafood at People on Water, the Ningbonese Chinese cuisine restaurant and enjoy views of the impressive Shanghai skyline from the level 39 Penthouse Bar.
